posts.title: PHP Blog
posts.subtitle: Built with JQuery/Ajax and PHP
posts.content:
A blog built with a JQuery & Ajax framework with a PHP back-end. This was my first big PHP project, and was really the stepping step into back-end programmer - I haven't looked back since.

Even now (2017) looking at the work I did, I'm impressed with what I achieved. Even though the code itself is heavily outdated it's a reminder of how far I've gotten. It has given me inspiration to rebuild a new blog using C# & Angular.

Features

  • I have my own admin panel, encrypted passwords, form validation, login securely
  • Create, edit and delete posts
  • Sort by date, time or popularity (based on IP's)
  • Create a keyword when a word has '#' before it
  • Search bar for searching keywords or a specific subject, this can be within a category or the whole blog
  • Embedded specific HTML tags within the posts
  • URL rewriting for individual posts
  • Posts are categorised
  • Responsive, fresh new design
  • Featured posts that appear at the top
  • Dynamic loading of posts when you hit the bottom of the page using AJAX
  • PHP, AJAX and MySQL commenting system
  • Upload function for admin
  • Admin panel now has a guest login to see behind the scenes
See it here
